date.headline: Project Elvis
date.text: Yamaha begins development on a very early build of Vocaloid codenamed Project Elvis

date.headline: Project Daisy Announced
date.text: Project Daisy, another early build of Vocaloid, was announced by Hideki Kenmochi

date.headline: "HISTORY OF LOGIC SYSTEM" released
date.text: Electronic artist Hideki Matsutake releases the album "HISTORY OF LOGIC SYSTEM", containing the first released render of VOCALOID: the song "あの素晴らしい愛をもう一度 [To Be Together Again]" utilizes early developments of MEIKO and KAITO's voice banks

asset.caption: "あの素晴しい愛をもう一度 [To Be Together Again]"

date.headline: First Vocaloid products released
date.text: Vocaloids LEON and LOLA were released by Zero-G, marketed as "Virtual Soul Vocalists"

date.headline: First LEON/LOLA song uploaded to Nico Nico Douga
date.text: User Komadori uploaded a Vocaloid arrangement of the song "おてんば恋娘[Beloved Tomboyish Girl]", originally from the Touhou series, to the site Nico Nico Douga, which later became a major place of growth for many Vocaloid producers

asset.caption: "おてんば恋娘[Beloved Tomboyish Girl]"

date.headline: First Vocaloid concert appearance
date.text: Polyphony Studio featured the Vocaloid voice of MIRIAM in their performance of "Sad Mondays", originally by Dr. Ravi E. Dattatreya

asset.caption: Original recording of the live appearance made by MIRIAM (note: click the image to hear it!)

date.headline: First full Vocaloid album released
date.text: The album "Место под солнцем [A Place In the Sun]" by Alexei Ustinov was released, containing vocals by LEON

asset.caption: "Место под солнцем [A Place in the Sun]"

date.headline: VOCALOID2 announced
date.text: VOCALOID2 featured a new and improved UI, as well as a completely revamped synthesis engine which focused more on samples than voice analysis

date.headline: Character Vocal Series announced
date.text: Crypton Future Media announces the "Character Vocal Series" -- combining animated characters with voicebanks

date.headline: Hatsune Miku released
date.text: The first character of Crypton Future Media's Character Vocal Series, Hatsune Miku (codename CV01), was released

asset.caption: First ever PV for Miku, featuring a performance of "01_ballade" (demo version of "Fragments of the Stars") by Eiji Hirasawa

date.headline: First VOM@S event
date.text: The first Vocaloid-centered convention, "THE VOC@LOID M@STER" (abbreviated as VOM@S), was held in Japan

asset.caption: Promotional flyer for VOM@S event 2

date.headline: Kagamine Rin & Len released
date.text: The next two developed characters in the Character Vocal Series, Kagamine Rin and Len (collectively CV02), were released

asset.caption: Official demo song for Kagamine Len, "L-Side" (composer unknown)

date.headline: Vocaloid racing
date.text: Both Studie GLAD Racing and Team MOLA received sponsorships from Crypton Future Media in the 2008 season and as a result decorated their cars with Vocaloid likenesses; Studie GLAD featured a BMW Z4 with Hatsune Miku's likeness, and Team MOLA featured the likenesses of the Kagamine twins

asset.caption: Team MOLA's Nissan Fairlady Z, adorned with the likenesses of Kagamine Rin & Len, used in the 2008 SUPER GT series

date.headline: First Vocaloid video game released
date.text: The first Vocaloid-themed rhythm game, "Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA-" is released by SEGA for the PlayStation Portable

asset.caption: Official Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- release trailer

date.headline: First Vocaloid arcade machine released
date.text: SEGA's arcade machine department, SEGA AM2, released "Project DIVA Arcade", an adaptation of the PSP game

asset.caption: Project DIVA Arcade machine, found at Round One arcade

date.headline: Vocaloid makes a stage debut
date.text: As a promotion for SEGA's Project DIVA game, the main Crypton Future Media Vocaloids (Hatsune Miku, Megurine Luka, and the Kagamine twins) made a live concert debut in Tokyo titled "Miku no Hi Kanshasai 39's Giving Day"

asset.caption: Live footage of Megurine Luka performing 'Double Lariat' at 39's Giving Day

date.headline: Vocaloid goes into space
date.text: The Akatsuki (aka PLANET-C) venus probe was launched from the Tanegashima Space Center, which (thanks to a petition organized by JAXA) contained three illustration panels of Hatsune Miku

asset.caption: Wide-angle view of the Akatsuki launch

date.headline: First Vocaloid concert in America
date.text: At Anime Expo 2011, the Crypton Future Media Vocaloids made a holographic live American stage debut at the Nokia Stage in Los Angeles

asset.caption: Live footage of Hatsune Miku's virtual debut at Anime Expo 2011

date.headline: VOCALOID3 released
date.text: Updates included: Support for Chinese, Korean, and Spanish; improvements to the vocal engine (as well as a "classic" mode for less realistic results); triphone support; and VocaListener, which uses human singing as a template to reproduce in the Vocaloid style

date.headline: First Spanish-native Vocaloids released
date.text: Vocaloids Bruno and Clara, the first Spanish-native voicebanks, were released

asset.caption: "FIESTA" by VNaneP, featuring Bruno and Clara

date.headline: First Chinese-native Vocaloid released
date.text: Vsinger (formerly VOCALOID CHINA) announced their first voicebank/character Luo Tianyi

asset.caption: Luo Tianyi's official demo song, "Step On Your Heart" by Luna Safari

date.headline: Domino's App feat. Hatsune Miku
date.text: Domino's Pizza announces a marketing campaign featuring Hatsune Miku, complete with a redesigned Domino's app, scooters, and pizza boxes featuring Miku's likeness

asset.caption: Official commercial for the Domino's App feat. Hatsune Miku

date.headline: Vocaloids on TV (sorta)
date.text: Frederator Studios releases the pilot episode of Bee and Puppycat as part of its YouTube channel Cartoon Hangover, with the main character Puppycat being voiced by the Vocaloid Oliver

asset.caption: Official trailer for Bee and Puppycat

date.headline: VOCALOID4 released
date.text: Updates included: Adding vocal "growl" features; cross-synthesis (rendering of multiple vocal styles in one take); realtime input

date.headline: VOCALOID5 released
date.text: Updates included: a redesigned UI; finer vocal control features

date.headline: Project SEKAI released
date.text: The current most popular Vocaloid game, "Project SEKAI COLORFUL STAGE!", was released for iOS and Android

asset.caption: Official announcement trailer for "Project SEKAI COLORFUL STAGE!"

date.headline: Charlie is released
date.text: Communication robot Charlie is released, which uses VOCALOID technology to communicate and answer questions with realistic human speech

asset.caption: Official "Life with Charlie" trailer

date.headline: VOCALOID6 released
date.text: Updates included a new VOCALOID:AI feature, which uses the assistance of AI to recreate the nuances of human vocal performance as realistically as possible

date.headline: First AI Voicebank released
date.text: Yamaha officially released "AI Megpoid", a remake of Megpoid for the new VOCALOID:AI feature

asset.caption: Official demo track for Megpoid AI

date.headline: Po-uta released
date.text: Yamaha releases Po-uta, a Vocaloid and collaborative effort featuring the voice of Porter Robinson

asset.caption: Official demo track for Po-uta
